channel.title: Players cannot connect to my server
channel.description:
I successfully portforwarded, set up a no-ip, made an exception in my firewall, and my friend was able to play on my server for around 2 days. The next day my ip changed on no-ip and then he started having problems connecting to my server and I tried on my brothers computer and I was not able to connect on that computer either. Do I have to make my ip static on no-ip or what? Im kind of a noob with these kind of things so help would be great. Thanks in advance.
EDIT: Also I have tried on a few different sources and clients to make sure it wasnt just the one. Thanks

item.title: Players cannot connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

no problem I guess your ip changes so making a static ip will just leave it at the ip

Read full topic
item.source: Players cannot connect to my server

item.title: Players cannot connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @david20x6 david20x6
item.description:
@david20x6 wrote:

thanks i thought i needed a static ip but it was never mentioned in any of the youtube guides i used to make the server and since it worked at first i figured i did everything but i guess on the videos it was assumed i already had a static ip

Read full topic
item.source: Players cannot connect to my server

item.title: Players cannot connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

Things to do or check
Change your old ip in the client to the new one compile & upload, release it.
Have your source running then go to canyouseeme.org and see if it says that it can see your service if not you need to make a static ip and portforward again.

Read full topic
